item.title: Making design theory
item.description: ...the presence of many different definitions is instrumental as we try to understand and articulate what things like "design" or "designing" are; this absence of unified definitions is not a conceptual shortcoming of our thinking but in fact an effective strategy for coping with certain kinds of complexity although this is not something we have made explicit. At times it seems as if one of the key characteristics of design is to base its very existence on the complexities arising from dichotomies.
